PRODUCT FEATURES
Filling pots on the stove has never been easier or more affordable, thanks to the new Delta Pot Filler faucet. Very competitively priced, the ADA compliant Pot Filler features a wall-mount, dual swing joint design with dual shut off valves and a 4 gpm flow rate to fill large pots in no time. A pot filler makes it easy to fill large cooking vessels quickly and without the walk from sink to stove.
  • Dual shut off on the Delta Pot Filler faucet allows the user to turn the water off at either the wall or the spout, controlling the water flow at the point of use
  • 24 in. dual swing joints allow the pot filler to easily fold away when not in use
  • Simple on and off with a quarter turn of the handle
  • Simple on and off with a quarter turn of the handle
  • Meets standards set by Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA)
  • Single hole installation
  • Assembled dimensions: 8-1/8 in. H x 21-9/16 in. D x 2-1/8 in. W

Q&A

How can I order this?

I understand it doesn't begin to ship until 9/22/14, but I'd like to order one now. Thank you
Asked by: mjp2732
HI mjp2732, Thank you for your question. You can order the model 1165LF-AR pot filler from your local retailer or wholesaler that sells Delta products. The allowable order date for this model was 8/22/2014. Thanks, Dave
Answered by: DeltaFaucet2
Date published: 2024-03-28

Whats the difference between the stainless finish &amp; the arctic stainless finish on your pot filler? I currently have brushed nickel fixtures &amp; would like to get as close as possible to match the existing.

Asked by: Kevin
Hi Kevin, Thank you for your inquiry! Arctic Stainless is a brushed finish like Stainless Steel. Over the years, the color of stainless steel used on appliances and sinks has migrated from warmer tones, with more red in the color spectrum, to lighter tones where blue is more predominant. Arctic Stainless features cooler metallic tones, following a trend seen throughout the kitchen. Stainless Steel is has warmer tones, similar to brushed nickel. Best regards, Tanya
Answered by: Tanya
Date published: 2024-03-28

Does this pot filler (1165LF-SS) require a valve body within the wall and, if so, what is the model number(s)?

Need to install pot filler in a new house still under construction. Does this pot filler need a valve body within the wall similar to tub/shower valve bodies? If there is one, does it come with it or does it need to be ordered separately? Also, what is the model# of the valve body?
Asked by: Rob
Hi Rob, Thank you for your question! This unit will included everything needed for the installation. It connects directly to a 1/2&quot; IPS supply pipe. Best regards, Jon
Answered by: DeltaFaucet3
Date published: 2016-11-30

Can I have a manual or instructions on how to leave the preparation in the wall?

Asked by: Juan Camou
Dear Juan Camou, Thank you for your question. Below, I have attached the Maintenance/Installation Owner's Manual and Technical Specification documents for the Delta Wall Mount Pot Filler 1165LF. https://media.deltafaucet.com/MandI/86362%20Rev%20A.pdf https://media.deltafaucet.com/SpecSheet/DSP-K-1165LF%20Rev%20C.pdf Best regards, Tanya
Answered by: Tanya
Date published: 2017-10-04

What is the material of the 1165lf-ss?

Asked by: kcla
Thank you for your question, kcla. This faucet is primarily Brass (spout) and Zinc (handles). Best regards, Jon
Answered by: Delta Faucet
Date published: 2024-03-28

Is this product compliant with California lead laws?

Asked by: 341Glenn
Thank you for your question, 341Glenn! All Delta Faucet Company products meet or exceed the requirements of applicable product performance and safety industry standards, as well as the federal Safe Drinking Water Act. Best regards, Edward
Answered by: Delta Faucet
Date published: 2024-03-28

I want to install this faucet so that when the faucet is folded up and against the wall it is the center of my wall.

In order to do this I need to know the dimension from end to end when folded flat and the measurement showing the center of where the faucet connects to the wall from each end of the folded flat faucet. (example, the center of the connection to the left end is X inches and the center of the connection to the right end is Y inches). Then I will be able to determine where to make my 1&quot; rough in faucet supply. Thank you.
Asked by: Reed
Hi Reed, Thank you for your question. The aerator will line up with the center of the supply connection when the spout is folded. When folded, the center of the upper arm joint to the center of the supply will be 10.5&quot;, and the end of the handle extends past the center of the supply by 2.1&quot;. For more information, please see the Technical Specifications: http://www.deltafaucet.com/customersupport/documentation/1165lf-ss.html?document=ts&amp;fromDetailArea=kitchen&amp;documentIndex=0#flashWrapper Best regards, Jon
Answered by: DeltaFaucet3
Date published: 2024-03-28

How do I change out the handle and valve cartridge on the 1st valve? &ldquo;Closest one to the water inlet.&rdquo; Is there how to videos somewhere on this? There is nothing on YouTube.&nbsp;

Asked by: Darren
I received a replacement cartridge and handle for my leaking pot filler 1165LF. Unfortunately no instructions are included. While searching for how to replace the cartridge I found conflicting and confusing instructions. It would be great if clear instructions and even a video link came with the parts. Step 1 is to unscrew the round cylinder handle piece from the circular handle piece attached to the the pot filler faucet (there are two handles, so this is for whichever cartridge behind the handle needs to be replaced). Then use a hex screw bit to unscrew and remove the circular handle piece. Now you can continue be removed the cartridge screw and the cartridge. Key thing to note from other posts I found regarding this is you cannot just pull handle off. It is screwed into the faucet arm which the above steps handle (no pun intended)
Answered by: Mark55
Date published: 2025-01-25
